profile_data.summary:
As a Data Analyst, I have delved into critical thinking, problem-solving, and data analytics skills to perform my tasks. I have a good amount of experience in handling huge amounts of data as the application is a downstream system that receives a huge volume of data from various upstream systems. 
I was inspired by how my clients used this data and came up with hidden insights to answer business problems. This has shown me the importance of data and how companies are moving towards a data-driven decision-making approach. I have started cultivating an interest in it and wanted to pursue my career in the field of data analytics. Through this master's degree, I am enhancing my analytical thinking and problem-solving skills. I look forward to aligning my interests in business leadership, managerial domains, and technical skills with a plethora of cultures and perspectives. 

🔑 My Key-Skills:
1. Making Data Easy to Understand: I can explain complicated things in simple ways and make charts that are interesting.
2. Solving Problems: I'm good at finding patterns in information and coming up with solutions.
3. Getting Things Done on Time: I'm really good at managing my time, doing important things first, and finishing tasks when they need to be done.
4. Managing Projects: I can handle many big projects at once, make plans for them, keep track of progress, and change things quickly if needed.
5. Improving Business Processes: I understand how companies work and can help make them work even better by talking to different people and writing down what they need.
6. Always Learning: I keep learning about new things in my field so I can stay really good at what I do.

If not at work, you will often find me involved in painting, swimming and experimenting in the kitchen!

Skillsets:
Programming: SQL, SAS, Python, Unix
Data Science/ ML: Data Analysis, Designing Predictive Model, Regression Analysis, Decision Tree, Random Forest, Logistic Regression, KNN, Naïve Bayes (Classification), K-means Clustering, Linear and Polynomial Regression, Neural Network, pandas, Numpy
Data Visualization Tools: Tableau, Power BI
Database: SQL SERVER, Oracle
Software Tools: Visual Studio, Azure(VSTS), MS Excel, MS Power Point, Jupyter notebook, Putty, AWS
profile_data.headline: Pricing Analyst @WestfieldInsurance | Data Analyst @Accenture | MS Business Analytics | Statistical Analysis | Data Visualization | Business Intelligence | Python | SQL | Excel

experience.description:
As a Pricing Analyst, My role involves data-driven insights to support pricing and actuarial analyses, working with large datasets, statistical modeling, and collaborating across teams to enhance pricing accuracy and efficiency.

Key Responsibilities:
- Extract, transform, and manipulate raw data from multiple sources to support pricing strategies and actuarial analyses.
- Validate rating algorithms and associated factors by identifying discrepancies, troubleshooting issues, and implementing necessary fixes to improve pricing models.
- Communicate identified issues and proposed solutions with external partners and stakeholders to ensure accurate pricing structures.
- Execute, monitor, and debug statistical rerating software to ensure consistent and reliable pricing analyses.
- Implement, validate, and test rate and rule changes within rating systems while ensuring compliance with business and regulatory requirements.
experience.title: Pricing Analyst

member.occupation: Pricing Analyst @WestfieldInsurance | Data Analyst @Accenture | MS Business Analytics | Statistical Analysis | Data Visualization | Business Intelligence | Python | SQL | Excel

projects.description:
Collaborated with Gaiadhi to enhance agricultural decision-making using advanced machine learning techniques and crop science through the Holos platform. The project aimed to integrate and analyze diverse weather datasets to improve prediction accuracy and optimize agricultural outputs.
Key Contributions:
1. Integrated NASA Power API and Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) data, improving the accuracy of weather predictions by calibrating global datasets with localized anchor points.
2. Employed Ridge regression, Linear Regression, Lasso regression, and Support Vector Machines (SVM) to benchmark weather conditions and optimize crop yield predictions.
3. Developed predictive models that significantly enhanced the applicability of weather data for precision agriculture, facilitating better strategic crop selection and agricultural planning.
4. Led a team of 4 to design and implement data-driven agricultural solutions, improving crop yield by 20% and reducing water usage by 15%.
5. Analyzed sensor data from 100+ devices to monitor soil moisture, temperature, and crop health.
6. Developed predictive models for crop disease forecasting, minimizing potential losses by 10%.
Presented findings to stakeholders, securing approval for advanced analytics implementation in farming operations.
projects.title: CAPSTONE: Enhancing Weather Predictions for Precision Agriculture

member.occupation: Pricing Analyst @WestfieldInsurance | Data Analyst @Accenture | MS Business Analytics | Statistical Analysis | Data Visualization | Business Intelligence | Python | SQL | Excel

projects.description:
Extracted strategic insights by clustering and topic modeling patent data to identify key trends in 3G and 4G technologies. The project highlighted the use of advanced NLP techniques to derive meaningful insights from vast patent datasets. The analysis provided valuable foresight into technological advancements and innovation hotspots in telecommunications.
Key Contributions:
1. Transformed complex patent information into practical recommendations, facilitating well-informed decision-making in the fast-paced telecommunications sector.
2. Implemented state-of-the-art topic modeling algorithms (LDA, LSA, NMF) to discern trends and patterns within the patent data, contributing to a comprehensive understanding of thematic areas in 4G and 5G technologies.
projects.title: 3G and 4G Patent Analysis

member.occupation: Pricing Analyst @WestfieldInsurance | Data Analyst @Accenture | MS Business Analytics | Statistical Analysis | Data Visualization | Business Intelligence | Python | SQL | Excel

projects.description:
Business Problem:
As data analysts, the goal will be determining sales prices for housing data of customers by a real estate company called “Ames Real Estate Associates” (AREA) to help them improve their ability to predict house prices and identify the factors that are likely to increase the price of homes that their customers want to sell. Developing a model which correctly predicts the value or selling price for your asset (house) considering all the characteristics and factors is important.

Methodology:-
Complete use of SEEMA data modeling method with using SAS, Tableau, and Alteryx as the computational tools.
Using a combination of the following statistical and data mining techniques to analyze, train and validate the given data set:-
Data exploration and modification:- Data visualization (Tableau), Variable Encoding, outlier impacts
Variable selection:- PCA, Multiple Regression (LASSO), Stepwise selection
Modeling:- Clustering, Multiple Regression.
Analysis and Validation:- Adjusted R square, AIC.

Using the insights from modeling to answer the following business questions:-

1)What factors influence the price of a house?
2)What is the expected selling price of a home?
3)Which factors are more important than others? 
4)Which homes should the client compare their house to?
5)When is the best time of the year to sell the house? 
6)How much should one invest in improving the condition of his/her house to increase the expected price by more than the cost of improvements?
projects.title: Predictive data model on real estate customer housing

projects.description:
Predicted customer response to marketing campaigns using advanced analytics techniques to improve marketing effectiveness and resource allocation. This project underscored the power of predictive analytics in driving marketing strategy. The ability to identify and target high-probability customers resulted in significant improvements in campaign ROI and resource efficiency.
Key Contributions:
1. Predicted customer response of marketing campaign using SAS Miner, increasing positive response rate 
 from 11% to 26% and reducing resource consumption by 75%.
2. Analyzed a dataset of 45,000 customers, applied advanced analytics techniques including logistic 
 regression and classification modeling, and identified key factors that influenced term deposit 
 subscriptions, providing actionable insights for targeted marketing campaigns.
projects.title: Bank Term Deposit Subscription Prediction

member.occupation: Pricing Analyst @WestfieldInsurance | Data Analyst @Accenture | MS Business Analytics | Statistical Analysis | Data Visualization | Business Intelligence | Python | SQL | Excel

projects.description:
As diabetes is a chronic disease prediction of it at early stages can lead to Improvement. Various data mining techniques are used to predict this at early stages by collecting significant attributes. In this study diabetes is predicted with the help of significant attributes that is the symptoms of the patients such as pregnancy, level of insulin, glucose, blood pressure, skin thickness, BMI, age. I have examine the diagnosis of diabetes to logistic regression and box plot graphs.
Research Questions:
1. What factors influence the prediction of diabetic patient.
2. What factors are more important than others
3. Which symptoms do patients have to concentrate more on like which have more chances of having diabetes
4. To find out if there is difference in the average age or BMI of patient with diabetes and without diabetes
projects.title: Prediction of diabetes in a patient using regression analysis
